The claim that Donald Trump "never changed one immigration law" is partially accurate, as there may have been smaller changes or adjustments made during his presidency. However, the evidence suggests that Trump did make some changes to immigration policies, even if they were not comprehensive changes to existing laws. The intent behind the claim, that Trump's presidency did not have a lasting impact on the country's immigration system, is also partially supported by the evidence, as Trump's changes may not have had a lasting impact.
